this week we are trying to replicate the recipeÂ Â

we're going to try and figure out. Now I'veÂ

inevitably people who get all those ingredientsÂ 
and make them put it all together and then sayÂ Â

So i'm going to have a go I'm going to get JamesÂ 
to have a go and Dave to have a go and see whoÂ Â

can get the closest to what Coke tastes like andÂ 
then we'll give you those recipes. So first of allÂ Â

what are all these extracts? Well this isÂ 
plain water because we need some water thisÂ Â

one here is sugar syrup to make that we've gotÂ 
equal parts of sugar and water just heat it upÂ Â

until the sugar's dissolved let it cool put itÂ 
in the bottle. This one is a light caramel soÂ Â

to make that I've put the sugar and the water andÂ 
a little bit of glucose syrup in a pan and heatedÂ Â

it up just until it gets to hard crack point thenÂ 
added back in more water until we got that smoothÂ Â

syrup. I did the exact same thing with this oneÂ 
except instead of pulling it off the pan whenÂ Â

it was just at crack hard stage I left it thereÂ 
for a bit longer so we've got a deeper caramelÂ Â

and the same again for this one but thisÂ 
one I left it there long enough to burnÂ Â

and I also added a little bit of citric acid intoÂ 
it in the process which gave it that really darkÂ Â

color. The reason I did that even though I thinkÂ 
it tastes awful really bad ğŸ¥´ is because one of theÂ Â

main additives in coke is a color 150d whichÂ 
is also a flavor which from what I've read isÂ Â

made by heating sugar with an acid until it getsÂ 
that deep color and a slightly burnt sugar aroma,Â Â

so who knows that might be our secret to gettingÂ 
the right color and the right flavor ... maybeÂ Â

not. Over here I've got a mixture based onÂ 
all different recipes I've seen online forÂ Â

coke so here i've got some fresh fruit extractsÂ 
to make those I firstly just took the fruit andÂ Â

grated that little outside bit of the rind off youÂ 
don't want the white just the colored bit of theÂ Â

rind then put that into a pan with some juice andÂ 
I'll put all these recipe amounts on the websiteÂ Â

so if you want to make it you can and then justÂ 
heated that up until it boiled and then left itÂ Â

just to sit and let all the flavor from the rindÂ 
infuse into the liquid. I then just strained thatÂ Â

with the orange i could just use a sieve to strainÂ 
it with the other two with the lime and the lemonÂ Â

it tended to go straight through the sieve so IÂ 
then had to use a cheesecloth to strain those soÂ Â

that we were left just with a liquid becauseÂ 
we don't want chunks in the Coke. Next hereÂ Â

we've got the spices we've got vanilla cinnamonÂ 
and nutmeg these ones are all from differentÂ Â

leaves I have heard that Coca-Cola still has cocaÂ 
leaf in it which is the leaf that's used to makeÂ Â

cocaine so I can't get coca leaf here in AustraliaÂ 
and I believe the us you can't get it either andÂ Â

the coal a bit was from cola nuts which is whereÂ 
the caffeine comes from. I'm not actually going toÂ Â

add any caffeine because that's not actually goingÂ 
to affect the flavor I'm just after the flavor andÂ Â

if you want to add caffeine later you can but backÂ 
to the coca leaf the coca leaf that they use nowÂ Â

has been decocainized in other words the cocaineÂ
